title: Designing Mobile Math Learning Strategies for Adult Learners: Enhancing Formula Application and Problem-Solving Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device proficiency, experience in mathematics education, foundational understanding of equations/functions/graphs, familiarity with basic statistical concepts
context.additional_context: A course focused on strengthening mathematics teaching competencies using mobile learning tools for pre-service and in-service teachers. Special emphasis is placed on improving learners' computational skills, formula application accuracy, and problem-solving abilities, with the goal of cultivating graph interpretation and statistical analysis skills.

learning_goals: Utilize the four core variables of the UTAUT model (performance expectancy, effort expectancy, social influence, facilitating conditions) to develop mobile-based math problem-solving strategies and enhance formula application skills for core concepts (equations, functions, geometry)

Learners analyze three or more of the Big Five personality traits (openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness, neuroticism) using measurement tools, understand eight or more of ten provided math concepts (e.g., polynomials, derivatives, probability, statistics) with 80% accuracy in mobile learning environments, perform three or more of five personalized learning activities (e.g., game-based problem solving, collaborative graph analysis) designed according to personality traits, and evaluate formula derivation and proof abilities

Develop mobile learning scenarios applicable to actual math classes (equation solving, graph interpretation, statistical analysis) through project-based learning and strengthen data-driven problem-solving skills

resources: Mobile Learning Platform (e.g., Khan Academy, Google Classroom)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
